intro: Leucopogon infuscatus, commonly known as the black-leaved heath, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to southeastern Australia, where it typically grows in heathlands and open forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal and sandy environments. Leucopogon infuscatus plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for native pollinators.
